result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence Thermone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clarence Thermone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clarence Thermone was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.  Pay court costs and victim witness surcharges.  ALL to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 5/7/2020.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other  sentence, but concurrent to 13CF2889.
*10/29/2014 credit amended to 99 days.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clarence Thermone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court signed order amending the judgment of conviction to reflect a total of 99 days of sentence credit on count two. Copies sent to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, calendar successor, for review. mag
DOC request to review excessive sentence credit.

Defendant Clarence Thermone in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Defendant Clarence Thermone in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to 13CF2889, credit for 155 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/7/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/7/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Clarence Thermone in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Clarence Thermone in custody.  William Levins for Karyn Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 15.  

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Court orders Count 2 in case 13cf2889 read-in for sentencing purposes.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clarence Thermone in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Defendant Clarence Thermone in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Status, Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clarence Thermone in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Defendant Clarence Thermone in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ann T Bowe in court, defendant Clarence Thermone not in court, in custody.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense is going to wait until after the preliminary hearing for the bail review. Case calendared for BAIL REVIEW on 2/27/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Clarence Thermone in court with attorney Brian B Burke.  Defendant Clarence Thermone in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
AS TO COUNT 1:  On COURT'S OWN MOTION, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED without prejudice.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL IF HE REMAINS IN CUSTODY.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
